Key Match Events: Greece's Tasos Bakasetas scored the first goal in the 47th minute.
Caoimhín Kelleher made a great save in the 10th minute.
Greece's Mantalos scored the second goal in the 91st minute after a loose pass from Caoimhín Kelleher.
Pre-Game Insights: Heimir Hallgrímsson emphasized the importance of a calculated approach to banish bad memories of Athens.
Greece's win over England on Thursday was seen as a historic upset.
Post-Match Reflections: Heimir Hallgrímsson said that his players 'defended heroically' in the opening half, but added: 'We know we can do better. We saw that in the second half, we can do better.'

Ireland midfielder Josh Cullen said: 'It’s a trend that we need to try and get rid of soon because we come out, every intention to start the second half on the front foot and maybe by doing that we sort of lose our shape a little bit and open some gaps for the opposition.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in memory of Greece defender George Baldock, who was found dead at his home in Athens on Wednesday aged 31.
Ireland's next two fixtures are in a month's time, against Finland and then a trip to Wembley to play England.
Others: Greece now sit top of the League B Group 2 table on 12 points, while Ireland are back in third on 3 points.
The Nations League is linked to qualification for the European Championship finals, with a spot at Euro 2028 up for grabs.
